sentence.Network_en: " We fear reprisals, signore, " the abbess murmured.
sentence.Network_cn: “ 我们怕报复, 先生, ” 女修道院院长喃喃地说.

sentence.Network_en: Franlein Maria, I don't know how much the Mother Abbess has told you?
sentence.Network_cn: 玛丽亚小姐, 我不知道院长嬷嬷都跟你说了些什么?

sentence.Network_en: Abbess Julia : Yes , I have to pay a visit.
sentence.Network_cn: 是的, 我想去拜访一下.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from Old French abbesse 'female abbot', from ecclesiastical Latin abbatissa, from abbas, abbat- (see abbot)

entry.def: An abbess is the nun who is in charge of the other nuns in a convent.

means.word_mean: 1. the superior of a group of nuns

auth_sentence.content: A child of the frail Abbess of Leominster.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: A child of the frail Abbess of Leominster.

auth_sentence.content: "Mamma mia," the abbess says, shifting her bosom indignantly beneath her scapular.
